items.title: Canada sees large drop in population amid international students crackdown
bullets: • Canada’s population fell by 0.2% in the third quarter to stand at 41.6 million, down from 41.65 million on 1 July
• The drop marks a dramatic turnaround for a country that has long pegged its economic growth to immigration

bullets: • Mae Martin’s Wayward opens with a kind of horror that doesn’t announce itself

• But the real danger in Wayward is never the setting; it's the gaze that saturates it
• Alex, a trans police officer played by Martin embodies the exhausted labor of visibility

items.title: Italy makes a surprising discovery ahead of the Winter Olympics: dinosaur tracks
bullets: • Italy makes a surprising discovery ahead of the Winter Olympics: dinosaur tracks
• The tracks were found in Stelvio National Park, a protected area in the Alps of northern Italy
• Milan's Natural History Museum says the 3-mile wide "valley of the dinosaurs" is "one of the richest in the world" The footprints date back 210 million years, to the Late Triassic period

items.title: A stunning new forecast shows when thousands of glaciers will vanish
bullets: • New research reveals when glaciers around the world will vanish and why every fraction of a degree of warming could decide their fate
• The Alps could reach their highest rate of glacier loss between 2033 and 2041
• At +1.5 °C warming, this peak is projected to occur around 2041 with about 2,000 glaciers disappearing in a single year

items.title: Earth may have been ravaged by “invisible” explosions from space
bullets: • Earth may have been ravaged by âinvisible explosions from space
• Unlike crater-forming impacts, these events unleash extreme heat and pressure without leaving obvious scars, making them harder to detect
• Despite their potential for destruction, these explosive encounters remain poorly understood
• Recent research led by UC Santa Barbara Earth Science Emeritus Professor James Kennett argues that these powerful events deserve far more scientific attention

items.title: What went right this week: treating the ‘untreatable’, plus more

• The technique involves editing the genetic code of donor white T-cells to target cancer cells without attacking the patient’s body
• Alyssa Tapley, 13, was the first in the world to receive the treatment, known as BE-CAR7

items.title: Theater counts: Zootopia 2 fends off a surge of new titles to retain its spot as the widest release.
bullets: • Zootopia 2 scored $158.8 million in its first five days at the domestic box office and snatching the number one spot from Wicked: For Good
• This weekend the two top contenders will face off with a bevy of newcomers, including another sequel, looking to unseat the current champs
• The widest of those newcomers is Five Nights at Freddy’s 2, which starts out in 3,412 theaters

items.title: The Numbers Business Report: our official forecast for 2026
bullets: • The Numbers Business Report: our official forecast for 2026 box office
• Box office receipts are projected to reach $9.8 billion, a 10% increase on the anticipated 2025 total of $8.87 billion
• The Super Mario Galaxy, due on April 3, tops the slate with forecast receipts of $550 million
• Mid‑tier wide releases are forecast to generate $4.57 billion, up 10% year on year

items.title: Holiday theater counts: Wicked continues its reign as Zootopia 2 enters the arena
bullets: • Wicked: For Good racked up an impressive $147 million in its debut this past weekend
• Zootopia 2 brings back detectives Judy Hopps and Nick Wilde, who are once again partners in the police force, but their working relationship is under strain
• Walt Disney will release the sequel in 4,000 theaters throughout North America
